attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the configuration whether the chart should appear in an animated fashion. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the animation duration of the chart. `animationDuration` attribute is applicable only if animation of the chart is enabled. 

Default value: 1 sec
attrs.name: animationDuration

attrs.description: Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: While the `palette` attribute allows selecting a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (that is, column, line, pie etc.). Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma. For example, `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
attrs.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma
attrs.name: paletteColors

attrs.description: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: This attribute can be used to set the maximum height for the x-axis labels (data labels) excluding the x-axis title. If any label goes beyond this height, the label will be truncated. In stagger mode, the number of stagger lines will be reduced if they exceed this value.
attrs.name: maxLabelHeight

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you can customize the alignment of data labels (x-axis labels). There are 5 options: AUTO, WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode which means that the alignment of the data labels is determined automatically depending on the size of the chart. WRAP wraps the label text if it is too long to fit in one line. ROTATE rotates the labels vertically. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.
attrs.name: labelDisplay

attrs.description: When enabled in AUTO mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.
attrs.name: useEllipsesWhenOverflow

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels would show up as rotated labels on the chart.
attrs.name: rotateLabels

attrs.description: If you have opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels would show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.
attrs.name: slantLabels

attrs.description: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you have a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attribute just lets you do so. It allows to display every n(th) x-axis label.
attrs.name: labelStep

attrs.description: If you have opted for STAGGER mode as `labelDisplay`, using this attribute you can control how many lines to stagger the label to. By default, all labels are displayed in a single line.
attrs.name: staggerLines

attrs.description: Sets the configuration whether data values would be displayed along with the data plot on chart.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: If you have opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.
attrs.name: rotateValues

attrs.description: Whether to show chart limit values. If not specified `showYAxisValues` overrides this value.
attrs.name: showLimits

attrs.description: Whether to show div line values. If not specified `showYAxisValues` overrides this value.
attrs.name: showDivLineValues

attrs.description: The chart automatically tries to adjust divisional lines and limit values based on the data provided. However, if you want to set your explicit lower and upper limit values and number of divisional lines, first set this attribute to false. That would disable automatic adjustment of divisional lines.
attrs.name: adjustDiv

attrs.description: When you right click on the chart it shows a context menu. This attribute allows you to show or hide the "Print" option in the context menu.
attrs.name: showPrintMenuItem

attrs.description: Internally the chart decodes a Url that you set as link. Before invoking the link it again encodes the Url. If you are passing multilingual characters via a Url or do not want this decode-encode mechanism to be handled by chart you can set,`unescapeLinks='0'`.
attrs.name: unescapeLinks

attrs.description: Allows you to show or hide the value of the zero plane.
attrs.name: showZeroPlaneValue

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link Format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description:
Sets whether the `clickURL` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when the chart is clicked) overrides the `link` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when a data plot is clicked). 

Default value: 0 (`clickURL` does not override `link`)
attrs.name: clickURLOverridesPlotLinks

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the y-axis lower limit would be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the y-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
attrs.name: setAdaptiveYMin

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description: This attribute changes the theme of the chart. There are 7 types of themes which have been made according to the different color combinations.
attrs.name: theme

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show or hide data labels, data values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font size for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font color for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageColor

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a transparency for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a scale for magnifying all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when a chart begins to load. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: loadMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when the specified chart type is not supported. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when chart data begins loading. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if the data loaded for a chart is empty. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed if the data loaded for a chart is empty
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if the data loaded for a chart is empty.
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if the data loaded for a chart is empty.
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataEmptyMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataEmptyMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if the data to be loaded for the chart is invalid. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageScale

description: These attributes let you set and configure custom chart messages, using text as well as images. These attributes are supported in FusionCharts constructor (`FusionCharts({ })`).

attrs.description: The numerical (absolute) value which determines whether to make a horizontal shift to plot the next point. For example, if the Kagi line is running up (rally or decline in trend does not matter) and the next point to plot is having a value lower than the current point, then we have to run down. If the deviation between the 2 points is greater than the `reversalValue`, only then we make a horizontal shift to right and move down. Else, the next point is neglected in plotting and we do not move horizontally.
attrs.name: reversalValue

attrs.description: Same as `reversalValue` attribute, but in percentage (instead of absolute value).
attrs.name: reversalPercentage

attrs.description: Maximum horizontal shift possible. Percentage value with respect to the canvas width.
attrs.name: maxHShiftPercent

attrs.description: Color of line denoting rally trend.
attrs.name: rallyColor

attrs.description: Transparency of line denoting rally trend.
attrs.name: rallyAlpha

attrs.description: Thickness of line denoting rally trend.
attrs.name: rallyThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the line denoting rally trend should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (line rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: rallyDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when line denoting rally trend are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: rallyDashGap

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when line denoting rally trend are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: rallyDashLen

attrs.description: Color of line denoting decline trend.
attrs.name: declineColor

attrs.description: Transparency of line denoting decline trend.
attrs.name: declineAlpha

attrs.description: Thickness of line denoting decline trend.
attrs.name: declineThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the line denoting decline trend should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (line rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: declineDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when line denoting decline trend are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: declineDashGap

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when line denoting decline trend are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: declineDashLen

description: These attributes let you control the functional and cosmetic attribute of the Kagi.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: X-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisName

attrs.description: Y-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: yAxisName

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption, x-axis and y-axis names etc.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description:
This attribute if set to _0_, hides the x-axis of the chart. 

__Default value__: 1
attrs.name: showXAxisLine

attrs.description: Sets the transparency of the x-axis line. Will work only when _showxaxisline_ is set to 1.
attrs.name: axisLineAlpha

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the position of the x-axis in the chart. 

__Default value__: Bottom
attrs.name: xAxisPosition

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the position of the y-axis in the chart. 

__Default value__: Left
attrs.name: yAxisPosition

attrs.description: Sets color of the x-axis of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisLineColor

attrs.description: The y-axis of the charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not. The values of `showLimits` and `showDivLineValues`, if specified explicitly, overrides the value of this attribute.
attrs.name: showYAxisValues

attrs.description: If you opt to not rotate y-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to y-axis name.
attrs.name: yAxisNameWidth

attrs.description: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesStep

attrs.description: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you have special characters (UTF8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
attrs.name: rotateYAxisName

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you do not specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMaxValue

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you do not specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMinValue

attrs.description: Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: forceYAxisValueDecimals

attrs.description: If you've opted to not adjust div lines, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute.
attrs.name: yAxisValueDecimals

description: Using these attributes, you can set and configure x-axis labels, y-axis values and set chart cosmetics for the axis like color, alpha, etc.

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font family for the text
attrs.name: xAxisNameFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font color
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis font size
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be bold
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be italicized
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis alpha including font and background
attrs.name: xAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis background alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border padding
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border radius
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border thickness
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the x-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when the border around the x-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of x-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font family for the text
attrs.name: yAxisNameFont

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font color
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the y-axis (primary / secondary) font size
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be bold
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be italicized
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) alpha including font and background
attrs.name: yAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) background alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border padding
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border radius
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border thickness
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the y-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of y-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you have opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you have opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.range: stretch, tile, fit, fill, center, none
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageValign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHalign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image. This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart canvas. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as canvas background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: #FF5904, #FFFFFF.
attrs.name: canvasBgColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background transparency for the chart canvas. For gradient, separate the alpha value using comma. Example: 15, 50.
attrs.name: canvasBgAlpha

attrs.description: When a gradient is used to set the color of the canvas background, this attribute sets the ratio of the colors. Example : If the value of the `canvasBgColor` attribute is set as `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`, `canvasBgRatio` can be used to specify their ratio in the background.
attrs.name: canvasBgRatio

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background angle in case of gradient.
attrs.name: canvasBgAngle

attrs.description:
This attribute if set to _1_, shows a border around the canvas of the chart. 

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: showcanvasborder

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border color.
attrs.name: canvasBorderColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.
attrs.name: canvasBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you control transparency of canvas border.
attrs.name: canvasBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not.
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: If you have opted to show a label for any of your vLines in the chart, you can collectively configure whether to show border for all such labels using this attribute. If you want to show label border for just a particular vLine, you can over-ride this value by specifying border configuration for that specific vLine.
attrs.name: showVLineLabelBorder

attrs.description:
This attribute lets you set whether the vline labels will show up as rotated labels on the chart. 

Default value: 0
attrs.name: rotateVLineLabels

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoLeftMargin

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on top of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoTopMargin

attrs.description: Where to position the logo on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: logoPosition

attrs.description: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.
attrs.name: logoAlpha

attrs.description: You can also change the scale of an externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.
attrs.name: logoScale

attrs.description: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts Link Format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.
attrs.name: logoLink

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: Whether to apply the shadow effect for the data plot.
attrs.name: showShadow

attrs.description: Thickness of the lines on the chart.
attrs.name: lineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the lines on the chart.
attrs.name: lineAlpha

attrs.description:
Whether the lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (lines rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: lineDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: lineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: lineDashGap

description: These attributes let you configure how your lines would appear on the chart. Various other controls over plot cosmetics can be attained using this set of attributes.

attrs.description: Sets the font of the values in the chart
attrs.name: valueFont

attrs.description: Specifies the value font color
attrs.name: valueFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the value font size
attrs.name: valueFontSize

attrs.description: Whether value font should be bold
attrs.name: valueFontBold

attrs.description: Whether value font should be italicized
attrs.name: valueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for value text
attrs.name: valueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color around the value text
attrs.name: valueBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the value alpha including font and background
attrs.name: valueAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value font alpha
attrs.name: valueFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value background alpha
attrs.name: valueBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border alpha
attrs.name: valueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border thickness
attrs.name: valueBorderThickness

attrs.description: Sets the padding between the value and its surrounding border
attrs.name: valueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the value border radius
attrs.name: valueBorderRadius

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the data values should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: valueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the data values is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: valueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the data values is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: valueBorderDashGap

attrs.description:
Set this attribute to `1` to draw a border on the data value text. 

Default value: 0
attrs.name: textOutline

description: These attributes let you configure font, background and border cosmetics, of value text-field that appear for each data plot.

attrs.description: Whether to draw anchors on the chart.
attrs.name: drawAnchors

attrs.description: This attribute sets the number of sides the anchor will have. For example, an anchor with 3 sides would represent a triangle, with 4 it would be a square and so on.
attrs.name: anchorSides

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the starting angle of anchors.  

Default value: 90
attrs.name: anchorStartAngle

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Lets you set the border color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Helps you set border thickness of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Helps you set the background color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of entire anchors. If you need to hide the anchors on chart but still enable tool tips, set this as 0.
attrs.name: anchorAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

attrs.description:
If you want to use an external image (JPG/PNG) as an anchor,  this attribute lets you specify the URL. 

__Note__: Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use an image from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: anchorImageUrl

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a transparency for images displayed as anchors in charts. 

__Default value__: 100
attrs.name: anchorImageAlpha

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a scale for magnifying images displayed as anchors. 

 __Default value__: 100
attrs.name: anchorImageScale

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the padding between the anchor image and the border of the anchor. For the anchor image, instead of decreasing the size of the image this attribute crops the image.  

Default value: 1
attrs.name: anchorImagePadding

description: Anchors (or marker points) are polygons which appear at the joint of two consecutive data points. These are indicators to show the position of data points. The anchors handle tool tips and links for the data points. So, if you opt to not render anchors on a chart, the tool tips and links will not function. You can, however, hide them by setting alpha to 0 and still enable tool tips and links. You can customize all the facets of anchors using the properties below.

attrs.description: Whether to show the zero plane on chart (if negative values are present).
attrs.name: showZeroPlane

attrs.description: Whether to show alternate vertical colored grid bands.
attrs.name: showAlternateVGridColor

attrs.description: Color of alternate vertical colored grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateVGridColor

attrs.description: Alpha of alternate vertical colored grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateVGridAlpha

attrs.description: Number of horizontal axis division lines that you want on the chart.
attrs.name: numDivLines

attrs.description: Color for divisional lines
attrs.name: divLineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of divisional lines
attrs.name: divLineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineAlpha

attrs.description:
Whether the divisional lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (divisional lines rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: divLineDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: divLineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: divLineDashGap

attrs.description: Color for the Zero Plane. Zero Plane is the line or plane that appears at position 0 on the y-axis, when negative data is being shown on the chart.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneColor

attrs.description: Thickness of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: showAlternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridAlpha

attrs.description: Number of vertical axis division lines
attrs.name: numVDivLines

attrs.description: Color of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of vertical axis division lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineAlpha

attrs.description:
Whether the vertical divisional lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (vertical divisional lines using straight lines)
attrs.name: vDivLineDashed

attrs.description: Sets the width of each dash when vertical divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when vertical divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: vDivLineDashGap

description: Using this set of attributes, you can control the properties of divisional lines, zero plane and alternate color bands. Divisional Lines are horizontal or vertical lines running through the canvas. Each divisional line signifies a smaller unit of the entire axis thus aiding the users in interpreting the chart. The zero plane is a 2D plane that signifies the 0 position on the chart. If there are no negative numbers on the chart, you won't see a visible zero plane. Alternate color bands are colored blocks between two successive divisional lines.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas. For example, 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - for example, if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 would become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: The default unit of the numbers that you are providing to the chart.
attrs.name: defaultNumberScale

attrs.description: Unit of each block of the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleUnit

attrs.description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleValue

attrs.description:
If a data value is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `numberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `âformatNumberScaleâ: â1â` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `ânumberScaleUnitâ: âK, Mâ`, `ânumberScaleValueâ: â1000, 1000â`, and `âforceNumberScaleâ: â1â`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
attrs.name: forceNumberScale

attrs.description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
attrs.name: scaleRecursively

attrs.description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
attrs.name: maxScaleRecursion

attrs.description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
attrs.name: scaleSeparator

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
attrs.name: decimalSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give a error while converting to number. So, the chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator.
attrs.name: inDecimalSeparator

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give a error while converting to number. So, the chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator.
attrs.name: inThousandSeparator

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart would be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
attrs.name: forceDecimals

description: PowerCharts XT offers you a lot of options to format your numbers on the chart. Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers would round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: labelFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: labelFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size.
attrs.name: labelFontSize

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be bold or not.
attrs.name: labelFontBold

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be italicized or not.
attrs.name: labelFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
attrs.name: labelAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
attrs.name: labelBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
attrs.name: labelBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
attrs.name: labelBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
attrs.name: labelBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
attrs.name: labelBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around x-axis labels should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: labelBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets a link for all x-axis labels.
attrs.name: labelLink

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of all data labels of the chart.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify the `outCnvBaseFont` attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart, that is, all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart, that is, all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font family of the chart text which lies outside the canvas, that is, all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart, that is, all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart, that is, all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like caption, sub-caption etc.), you need to use the Styles feature of PowerCharts XT. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc.

attrs.description: Whether to show tool tip on chart.
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the border transparency for tool tip.
attrs.name: tooltipBorderAlpha

attrs.description: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipSepChar

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tool tips on the chart.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description: Sets the transparency of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipbgalpha

attrs.description: Sets the border radius of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipborderradius

attrs.description: Sets the border thickness of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipborderthickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the value and the border of the tooltip. If you want more space between the value and the border, you can use this attribute to control it.
attrs.name: toolTipPadding

attrs.description:
Specify custom text for the tooltip 

 You can either specify a constant string as the tooltip text or you can use variable values from the data level by prefixing a __$__ to the attribute name, for example, __$name__, __$value__.
attrs.name: plottooltext

description: These attributes let you control the tool tip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: Where to position the toolbar on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: toolbarPosition

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to x-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarX

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to y-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarY

attrs.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the toolbar on the chart.
attrs.name: toolbarHAlign

attrs.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the toolbar on the chart
attrs.name: toolbarVAlign

attrs.description: Sets the color of the toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonColor

attrs.description: Enables/disables display of tooltips for toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: showToolBarButtonTooltext

attrs.description: You can change the scale of the toolbar by specifying a value for this attribute.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonScale

description: Using this set of attributes, you can customize the toolbar on the chart. The advantage of having a toolbar is that it manages all the UI action elements (context menus, checkboxes, buttons) centrally. This provides a clean, uniform look and a better, more meaningful and logical grouping.

attrs.description:
Whether the chart will allow exporting to images, PDFs, SVG or XLSX.  

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: exportEnabled

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting, the action specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to client as download, or whether it'll be saved on the server. 

__Default value__: download
attrs.name: exportAction

attrs.description: In case of server side exporting, this refers to the path of the server-side export handler (the ready-to-use scripts that we provide).
attrs.name: exportHandler

attrs.description: Lets you configure what output formats to allow for export of chart, in the export context menu, and also customize the label for each menu item. The attribute value should be a pipe (|) delimited separated key-value pair. Example: `exportFormats: 'PNG=Export as High Quality Image|JPG|PDF=Export as PDF File'`
attrs.name: exportFormats

attrs.description:
This attributes sets the modes of export. To enable client-side exporting, set this attribute to __client__. 

__Default value__: auto. 

__Note__: Starting v3.12.1, the `exportMode` attribute replaces the `exportAtClientSide` attribute. However, you donât need to make any changes to the existing setup because, the FusionCharts library comes with the proper mapping already provided.
attrs.name: exportMode

attrs.description: Whether the menu items related to export (e.g., Save as JPEG etc.) will appear in the context menu of chart.
attrs.name: exportShowMenuItem

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting and when using download as action, this lefts you configure whether the return image, PDF, SVG or XLSX will open in same window (as an attachment for download), or whether it will open in a new window. 

__Default value__: _self
attrs.name: exportTargetWindow

attrs.description: Using this attribute you can specify the name (excluding the extension) of the output (export) file.
attrs.name: exportFileName

description: These attributes allow you to control the saving of chart as image, SVG or XLSX.

attrs.description: Whether to enable hover effect on charts for all elements
attrs.name: showHoverEffect

attrs.description: Sets whether to enable the hover effect on charts for anchors.
attrs.name: anchorHoverEffect

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the transparency for the anchors when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the number of sides of the anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverSides

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius of the anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverRadius

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color of anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBgHoverColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the transparency of anchorâs background when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBgHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the border color of anchors when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverColor

attrs.description: Sets the border's transparency of anchors when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the border thickness of the anchors when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverThickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the starting angle of the anchors when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverStartAngle

attrs.description:
This attribute adds a dip effect (different shapes) to the anchors on hover. When hovered a star shaped anchor is created. Using `anchorSides` attribute, you can specify the no. of sides for anchors. 
`Note : If the anchors are of circular shape, this attribute won't be applied on it.`
attrs.name: anchorHoverDip

attrs.description:
Anchors get animated when the normal radius and the hover radius are different. To disable this effect you can set anchorHoverAnimation = `0`. 

Default value: `1`
attrs.name: anchorHoverAnimation

description: If you wish to show an effect on the data plot (column, line anchor, pie etc.) when the user hovers his mouse over the data plot, these attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the hover for all data plots in the chart.

attrs.description: Lets you set the space between the canvas border and first & last data points
attrs.name: canvasPadding

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the chart canvas. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between caption and top of chart canvas. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.
attrs.name: captionPadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).
attrs.name: xAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).
attrs.name: yAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left or right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesPadding

attrs.description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.
attrs.name: labelPadding

attrs.description: It sets the vertical space between the end of columns and start of value textboxes. This basically helps you control the space you want between your columns or anchors and the value textboxes.
attrs.name: valuePadding

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartLeftMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartRightMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartTopMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put at the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartBottomMargin

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space between the start of chart canvas and the start (x) of chart. In case of 2D charts, the canvas is the visible rectangular box. Using this attribute, you can control the amount of empty space between the chart left side and canvas left side. By default, the chart automatically calculates this space depending on the elements to be placed on the chart. However, if you want to over-ride this value with a higher value, you can use this attribute to specify the same. Please note that you cannot specify a margin lower than what has been calculated by the chart. This attribute is particularly useful, when you have multiple charts placed in a page and want all their canvas start position to align with each other - so in such a case, you can set same margin value (a value large enough that it does not get rejected by chart owing to it being lower than the calculated value) for all such charts in the page.
attrs.name: canvasLeftMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between end of canvas and end of chart.
attrs.name: canvasRightMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between top of canvas and top of chart.
attrs.name: canvasTopMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between bottom of canvas and bottom of chart.
attrs.name: canvasBottomMargin

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionCharts Suite XT allows you manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. Padding in FusionCharts Suite XT is always defined in pixels, unless the attribute itself suggests some other scale (like `plotSpacePercent`, which configures the spacing using percentage values). You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. That means, FusionCharts Suite XT would not plot anything in that space. It is not necessary for you to specify any padding or margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.

attrs.description:
This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.

 __Note__: The `label` attribute replaces the `name` attribute. Previously, either one of the attributes could be used to set the label. Support for the `name` attribute has been discontinued since v3.10.0.
attrs.name: label

attrs.description: If instead of the numerical value of this data, you wish to display a custom string value, you can specify the same here. Examples are annotation for a data item etc.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you set the background alpha for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you set the background color for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you set the alpha for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorAlpha

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you define the number of sides for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorSides

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the starting angle for an anchor of a particular data.  

Default value: 90
attrs.name: anchorStartAngle

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you define the radius for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you set the border color for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: If you want to configure data item specific anchor properties, this attribute lets you set the border thickness for the anchor of that particular data item.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Numerical value for the data item. This value would be plotted on the chart.
attrs.name: value

attrs.description: If you want to define your own colors for the data items on chart, use this attribute to specify color for the data item.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: You can define links for individual data items. That enables the end user to click on data items (columns, lines, bars etc.) and drill down to other pages. To define the link for data items, use the link attribute. You can define links that open in same window, new window, pop-up window or frames. Please see Advanced Charting > Drill Down Charts for more information. Also, you need to URL Encode all the special characters (like ? and &) present in the link.
attrs.name: link

attrs.description: By default, PowerCharts XT shows the data item name and value as tool tip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tool tip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.
attrs.name: toolText

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show or hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showLabel

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show or hide values of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showValue

attrs.description: Whether the border of this data item should appear as dashed. This is particularly useful when you want to highlight a data (such as forecast or trend etc.).
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: This attribute determines the transparency of a data item. The range for this attribute is 0 to 100. 0 means complete transparency (the data item will not be shown on the chart) and 100 means opaque.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: labelFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: labelFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size.
attrs.name: labelFontSize

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be bold or not.
attrs.name: labelFontBold

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be italicized or not.
attrs.name: labelFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
attrs.name: labelAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
attrs.name: labelBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
attrs.name: labelBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
attrs.name: labelBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
attrs.name: labelBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
attrs.name: labelBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around x-axis labels should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: labelBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis label is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around x-axis label is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets the link for each individual x-axis label.
attrs.name: labelLink

attrs.description: This attribute can set the hover color for a particular anchor.
attrs.name: anchorHoverColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the transparency for an anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the number of sides for a particular anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverSides

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color of a particular anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBgHoverColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the transparency for a particular anchorâs background when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBgHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the border color of an anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverColor

attrs.description: Sets the border's transparency of an anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the border thickness of an anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorBorderHoverThickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the starting angle of an anchor when hovered.
attrs.name: anchorHoverStartAngle

attrs.description:
This attribute adds a dip effect (different shapes) to a particular anchor on hover. When hovered a star shaped anchor is created. Using `anchorSides` attribute, you can specify the no. of sides for anchors. 
`Note : If the anchors are of circular shape, this attribute won't be applied on it.`
attrs.name: anchorHoverDip

description:
Each instance of the `data` object represents a data value to be plotted on the chart. For a Kagi chart, one instance of the `data` object looks as shown in the example below: 

"data"[{
"label": "Day 60",
"value": "18.99"
}]
Attributes of the `data` object are used to set and configure the data values for the chart.

attrs.description: Set this attribute to __true__ to render a vertical data separator line.
attrs.name: vLine

attrs.description: This attribute defines the color of vertical separator line
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Thickness in pixels of the vertical separator line.
attrs.name: thickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the vertical separator line.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description:
Whether the vertical separator line should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (vertical separator line rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: Sets the width of each dash when vertical separator line is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: dashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when vertical separator line is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: dashGap

attrs.description: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart. This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with div line values on the chart.
attrs.name: valueOnRight

attrs.description: If you have opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.
attrs.name: thickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the trend line.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description:
Whether the trendline should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (trendline rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when trendline is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: dashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when trendline is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: dashGap

attrs.description: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `startValue` would be 102.
attrs.name: startValue

attrs.description: The ending y-axis value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `endValue` would be 109. If you do not specify a value for `endValue`, it would automatically assume the same value as `startValue`.
attrs.name: endValue

attrs.description: If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example:` displayValue='Last Month High'`. When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of `startValue`.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: Color of the trend line and its associated text
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Whether the trend will be displayed as a line or a zone (fill-colored rectangle).
attrs.name: isTrendZone

attrs.description: Whether the trend line or trend zone would be displayed over data plots or behind them.
attrs.name: showOnTop

attrs.description: Custom tool-text for this trend line or trend zone.
attrs.name: toolText

description:
Trend-lines are horizontal lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. The `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object is used to add trend-lines to a chart.

Although the `line` object has to be defined within the `trendlines` object, the latter cannot be used to collectively customize trend-lines, because it does not have any attributes of its own.

The attributes of the `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object, are used to create and customize trend-lines for charts.

attrs.description: Sets color of all the trend lines and its associated text in the chart.
attrs.name: trendlineColor

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of all the trend lines in your chart.
attrs.name: trendlineThickness

attrs.description: Sets transparency for all the trend lines in your charts.
attrs.name: trendlineAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the tooltip text of the trend-line. It accepts macros, plain text, and HTML tags, as string.
attrs.name: trendLineToolText

attrs.description: Whether all the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them.
attrs.name: showTrendlinesOnTop

description:
Trend-lines are horizontal lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. Cosmetics for all the trend-lines rendered can be attained using this set of attributes.

Although there are set of attributes of the `line object`, used to create and customize trend-lines, these set of attributes effect all the trend-lines rendered in your chart.

attrs.description: Sets the font family for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFont

attrs.description: Sets the font size for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFontSize

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be bold formatted. 

Default value: 0 (not bold formatted)
attrs.name: trendValueFontBold

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be italicized. 

Default value: 0 (not italicized)
attrs.name: trendValueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the background of the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the border around the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets padding for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the radius for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the thickness for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the trend-line display value should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashGap

description:
These attributes let you customize the text displayed with a trend-line. 

__Note__: These attributes belong to the `chart` object and  not to the `line` object (child of the `trendline` object). They are, therefore, applied to all trend-lines on your chart.
